page.title: 09L'pool Newsham,Loc. Hist (2)
page.content: The showpeople, Buffalo Bill, Annie Oakley and Chief Sitting Bull held a rodeo in Newsham in 1891. Sheil Rd., named after Richard Sheil the first Irish alderman on Liverpool Council, was cut through in 1862_63. The oldest surviving tenanted house in Liverpool (except for a barn in Aigburth Hall Rd.) is Tuebrook House, dating from 1615.There's a priest's hiding hole in the chimney and on the lintel are the initials JM_thought to be John Mercer, a local farmer. The church of St. John the Baptist (1871) contains a rare set of bells known as a Maiden Peal_cast without flaw which is a 1000-1 chance. Prescot Rd. was made a turnpike,1725, carrying a lot of traffic and in the last century, had it's own horse drawn buses.Famous inhabitants inc. Joseph Williamson,Dr.Solomon,William Joyce and Thomas Lister.
